name: How much do you know about Movies and TV? | Quiz

questions.text: Who was nearly cast as Sam on 'Cheers', but did NOT get the role?
questions.explanation:
Ed O'Neill.

	He was a school teacher before becoming an actor. He was also considered for the role as the father on 'Family Ties'.

Frankie Laine.

	His father worked as a barber in Chicago, and Al Capone was one of his clients.

questions.text: Which character has been portrayed more than anyone else in films?
questions.explanation:
Sherlock Holmes.

	This character had been portrayed 77 times by the end of the 20th century.

questions.text: Which of these TV shows has won the most Emmys?
questions.explanation:
Sesame Street.

	This program has won a total of 70 Emmys.

questions.text: What series of films has a character known as 007?
What is the longest running television show that was still on the air at the end of the 20th century?
questions.explanation:
Meet The Press.

	This program debuted on NBC-TV in 1947. It premiered on NBC radio 2 years earlier.

questions.text: On which TV show did Lee Majors get his start?
questions.explanation:
The Big Valley.

	He is sometimes credited as Lee Yeary, which is his real name.

questions.text: Who was the major star of the movie "The Titanic" with Kate Winslet?
questions.explanation:
Leonardo DiCaprio & DiCaprio.

	This star earned over one hundred million dollars for 'Titanic'.

questions.text: Out of the films listed, which one has had the most Oscar nominations?
options: Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom
questions.explanation:
Titanic.

	This film was nominated for 13 awards, but won 11.

Macaulay Culkin.

	Bonnie Bedelia is this star's aunt.
